page.title: 09Talbot's End Pond
page.content: The purpose of the pond in former times was to provide drinking water for horses and to allow farm carts with wooden wheels and iron rims to drive through to prevent the shrinking and falling apart of the wheels . For there reasons the pond was regularly maintained, and mud removed. With mains water and cattle troughs,this regular maintenance has stopped. A couple of years ago the pond was drained by some villagers cleared out, and repaired. A survey of the pond this year has revealed, that the following creatures live there : newts, caddis fly, mussels, water boatman, broad-bodied libella, Water crowfoot, damsel fly, Watersnail, toad and moorhen.
